title: The Into Tomorrow Radio Show MAY-16-2014 FRI
description:
The Into Tomorrow Radio Show MAY-16-2014 FRI


All About "Into Tomorrow"
Bringing you the latest in technology and consumer electronics every weekend,
thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s no other radio show like Into Tomorrow!

 

"Into Tomorrow" is the radio network program covering the latest in consumer electronics
 and technology. The program is hosted by Dave Graveline, one of the most talented and 
 professional award-winning radio and television hosts in the business. 
 The show is a dynamic blend of listener interaction and insightful and informative guests
 speaking on a variety of topics related to technology.


Ã¢â‚¬Å“Into Tomorrow with Dave GravelineÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬â€œ now in our 19th Year Ã¢â‚¬â€œ is a 3-hour radio program
 (as well as many ITTV Video Reports) covering the Latest in Consumer Electronics
 & Technology available today and Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ into tomorrow.
 The show airs on over 200 AM & FM radio stations around the U.S.,
 radio stations in Germany, Bermuda, New Zealand, Canada and several other sources
 including Mobile Broadcast Network, BeOS Radio, Sprint Radio, TiVo, and many others
 every weekend. 

"Into Tomorrow" is also heard around the world on the Armed Forces Networks
 in several other countries. In addition, they stream all their audio and video
 via their web site and provide free Podcasts of all show archives.

The ONLY international show covering Consumer Electronics exclusively for 19 years,
 "Into Tomorrow" highlights the way technology is changing our lives!
 From Gadgets & Gizmos to Home Theater, Digital Photography, Car Audio,
 Security & Navigation, High Tech Recreation, HDTV, Technology On-The-Go,
 GPS and everything else that people are talking about.

They also frequently broadcast from many trade shows and CE events around the world
 including CES Las Vegas ... IFA Berlin ... HomeTech Dubai ... 
 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona ... CeBIT Hannover ... CEATEC Japan ...
 photokina in Cologne ... Electronic House eXpo in Long Beach/Orlando ... 
 CTIA Wireless ... Computex Taipei in Taiwan ... and many others!

 

Heard Worldwide

Into Tomorrow with Dave Graveline is heard in many markets around the country.
 WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re constantly adding stations throughout the U.S. and Canada,
 as well as other affiliates around the world with the Armed Forces Radio Network.
 

Selected for distribution to American service people around the globe,
 Into Tomorrow is beamed via satellite to over 140 countries and U.S. territories
 (including remote areas of Alaska) via an agreement with the Armed Forces Radio
 and Television Service (AFRTS). The program reaches an additional potential audience
 of one million listeners as an on-going addition to the AFRTS schedule.
 From its Broadcast Center at March Air Force Base, Calif., 
 AFRTS uses several satellites to provide service to more than 1,000 authorized
 outlets as well as more than 400 US Navy ships at sea.
 AFRTS is operated by the Department of Defense to provide stateside programming
 to United States military personnel and their families stationed overseas.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re proud to be bringing our U.S. service personnel Ã¢â‚¬ËœInto TomorrowÃ¢â‚¬â„¢
 with Armed Forces Radio,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ said Dave Graveline, president of Advanced Productions.
 Ã¢â‚¬Å“Now, with AFRTS, serving your country doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t mean having to miss out on the latest
 in consumer technology.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Graveline, who created Into Tomorrow, also hosts the program
 and is its Executive Producer.

Into Tomorrow is highly interactive, with listeners encouraged to participate
 on the program with any questions about consumer electronics by calling toll-free
 from anywhere in North America: 1-800-899-INTO (4686) 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

The successful program (formerly called Ã¢â‚¬Å“Toys For BoysÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½),
 originally created, produced and hosted by Dave Graveline 
 for WIOD-AM in Miami, launched first statewide throughout Florida in January 1996.
 As of July, 1996, the program became available nationwide.
